intro: Matelea annulata, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique blooming pattern and striking appearance make it a popular subject in botanical studies and horticulture.
